channel.title: RNZ Media & Technology Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Media & Technology headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Robox a 'hunting ground' for sex offenders to groom child gamers - online safety
item.description: The warning comes as police say predators contact children through gaming platforms, then groom them to go into private chat rooms.

item.title: Pioneering Australian journalist George Negus dies aged 82
item.description: Last month, Negus's son Ned posted on LinkedIn that the broadcaster had been diagnosed with dementia five years previously.

item.title: Newspapers' social pages the place to be seen in pre-social media age
item.description: Before social media and the age of influencers, grabbing a coffee and the Sunday paper was an adrenaline-filled moment to see if you'd made the cut.

item.title: Miriama Kamo: 'I am going through a little bit of trauma'
item.description: The veteran journalist sat down with Anika Moa to talk about her career and not-never move into politics.

item.title: Miriama Kamo: 'I am going through a little bit of trauma'
item.description: The veteran journalist sat down with Anika Moa to talk about her career and not-never move into politics.

item.title: Tui brings back 'yeah right' campaign with billboard making a dig at Philip Polkinghorne
item.description: The brewery has kicked off with a sign that relates to the Phillip Polkinghorne trial. Marketing expert says " they just got it wrong" but DB has doubled down.

item.title: TVNZ seeks to buy new technology to help it sell more ads
item.description: The aim is to boost advertising on TVNZ's linear and on-demand platforms.

item.title: TVNZ signals further shrinkage in new cost-cutting measures
item.description: Analysis - Mediawatch looks at the background to the state broadcaster reducing scope and scale and asks if the scrapped media merger was a missed opportunity.

item.title: Review: This is the F#$%ing News by Patrick Gower
item.description: 'Paddy' Gower is most impressive in this memoir when he's most vulnerable, David Hill writes.

item.title: Job cuts confirmed at Whakaata Māori
item.description: Government ministers have yet to say how many jobs will go at the Māori television channel.

item.title: Mediawatch: Turning point for Australia's ABC
item.description: Mediawatch talks to the boss of Australia's public broadcaster about what it's up to - and up against - across the Tasman.

item.title: Philip Polkinghorne murder trial spotlights mental health in the media
item.description: Coverage of the trial blurred the lines on reporting suicide - and raised questions about how mental health can be aired in a healthy way.

item.title: Polkinghorne documentary confirmed by director Mark McNeill
item.description: With a not-guilty verdict still reverberating around the country, at least one film crew is working on a documentary. Is that a good thing?

item.title: RNZ cancels release of podcast episode featuring ex-minister Kiritapu Allan
item.description: The public broadcaster had promoted the episode of It's Personal with Anika Moa, but decided not to air the interview following an "editorial check".

item.title: Students using artificial intelligence to cheat on assessments, teachers warn
item.description: Teachers says artificial intelligence has huge potential for improving education, but misuse of the technology is an increasing problem.

item.title: Broadcaster Matt Heath is leaving Radio Hauraki
item.description: After a decade alongside good mate Jeremy Wells, Heath has taken up a role on Afternoons at Newstalk ZB.

item.title: Facebook admits to scraping every Australian adult user's public photos and posts
item.description: The company does not offer Australians an opt-out option like it does in the EU, because it has not been required to do so under privacy law.

item.title: Who follows the carnivore diet in New Zealand?
item.description: Jessica Henrard's 3-year-old daughter Winter is one of the younger members of the carnivore community.
